author: Barb
text:
Very much disappointed - I heard the rave about this site so I joined - yet how I’m let down by many things 
The cost of shipping is outrageous- other sites comparable is $12-$18 shipping( CAD) as yours being $48 - 
Shipping is charged on every transaction throughout a day - new items are uploaded twice a day so in order to get first access to the item you purchase immediately- then layer to do the same which costs a minimum of $100 fir shipping that day - very much feels like a scam 
When purchasing, adding item to bag, only have 20 minutes to complete sale before it’s available again- not enough time to continue shopping for other items to add to the order - so your again paying more in shipping to make another purchase or loose items
There is no place to see the policies of the site - it’s a trial by error - and hope your not scammed or continually contacting support with which I’d you wait for a response then you’ve again lost your item to someone else 
Notifications are received telling if item on sale yet when put item in bag it’s charging at current price not the sale price - again feels like a scam
The first look option is nothing different than not subscribing- there’s no early access to items before everyone else - there’s no updates on items other than the standard 10am/7pm - again another scam 
Everything about this site continues to cost you $$$$ or not work - it Seems as though it makes the rules as it goes that suits best for the site to get more cash and send the client in circles 
Not impressed at all with this site - the competitors are much more client focused and very easy to shop - this site is overall has much to restructure to be in the running for a “upscale”  business
title: Very much disappointed

author: customer
text:
I am SO disappointed with my last purchase. I bought this Emilio Pucci dress and right when I opened the package I could tell it was fake! 
I worked for the brand years ago and I love buying vintage pieces.
After inspecting the entire dress I decided to check the CARE TAG which is usually a big indication of authenticity. And I was correct. The care tag CLEARLY states the item was made in CHINA!
This is a big disappointment! Specially when your state your items are inspected

author: Lori
text: Size Medium skirt posted; size Zero sent.  Not a simple mixup as there was only one item available.  Took 1/2 a day of texting customer service to get a refund, then another to pay for return shipping; and yet another phone call to be reimbursed original shipping.  This was clearly a sloppy mistake by The Real Real, wasted a lot of my time, and I will not use them again.
title: Incorrect advertising

author: customer
text: Eexpensive shipping and returns, discount wasn't applicable and later found out no return was available on item, which is frustrating because of the high price items are being consigned at. I would love to be able to buy quality vintage and consigned pieces, but not being able to return items and the prohibitive costs of shipping is difficult to contend with. I doubt I will buy anything again, without first trying on the same items and designers in person which is disappointing and negates the ease and purpose of shopping online.
title: expensive shipping and returns

author: Customer
text:
Although The Real Real does an excellent job in getting the item sold once it is finally listed, it takes far too long to get to that step. As a "VIP" I thought there would be less time to wait but clearly that makes no difference. 

Customer service is quick to reply but nothing changes or speeds anything up afterward. 

I have sold many items. I only was (unpleasantly) surprised once when my Versace dress, bought for over a $1,000 was going to be listed at a selling price just over $100. Commission would have been less than $100. I requested my dress to be returned and they did so.
title: Patience is required

author: customer
text: The RealReal guarantees that each item is the authentic brand. When the Kate Spade shoulder bag I ordered arrived I realized that it might not be a real Kate Spade. One of the snaps doesn’t line up when trying to close the purse, which is a poor level of quality you would not find in an authentic designer bag. So I did research on genuine Kate Spade bags, and found a number of examples that the bag I paid for is fake, such as the brand label being a separate metal label that is glued onto the bag instead of the embossed label that is the only way Kate Spade labels their leather bags. I did not know any of this before ordering as I believed the site’s authenticity guarantee. The item is “final sale” which is even worse. I cannot use the bag, since anyone who knows what an actual Kate Spade bag looks like (I didn’t, I trusted the site) will know that I am carrying a fake bag. Very very upsetting that a site that in its very name guarantees that designer items are the genuine brand is selling fake merchandise. I have ordered a number of things before and have really enjoyed them; I don’t know if this was a fluke but if it can happen I once it is really hard to be confident in the guarantee.
title: Bag was not authentic
